qas.question: What is a word that can be used to describe the scope of a comprehensive school's intake?

answers.text: Academies Programme, Free Schools and University Technical Colleges

plausible_answers.text: Academies Programme, Free Schools and University Technical Colleges

plausible_answers.text: Academies Programme, Free Schools and University Technical Colleges

qas.question: What are some new initiatives that may impact the concept of uncomprehensive schools?

context: In principle, comprehensive schools were conceived as "<a0_0><b2_0><b3_0><b4_0>neighbourhood<b4_0/><b3_0/><b2_0/><a0_0/>" schools for all students in a specified catchment area. Current education reforms with <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>Academies Programme, Free Schools and University Technical Colleges<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> will no doubt have some impact on the comprehensive ideal but it is too early to say to what degree.
